subject: Technology
title: How the iPhone Changed Design
description: A short lesson to help you apply How the iPhone Changed Design.

hook.text: Before the iPhone, phones had dozens of buttons, antennas, and wildly different shapes.

buildup.text: The iPhone was a flat glass slab with one button. Competitors called it too simple to succeed.

discovery.text: Apple bet that touch gestures like pinch-to-zoom and swipe would feel natural. They were right.

twist.text: Within three years, every smartphone on the market looked like a glass rectangle. Variety vanished.

climax.text: Apple didn't just make a phone. It defined what every phone after it would look like.

punchline.text: One design killed a thousand others.

quiz.question: What design choice defined the iPhone?
options: A flat glass slab with one button and touch gestures
